intro: Phyllorkis leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leafed phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open woodlands and heathlands. Phyllorkis leptantha is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
